intro: Oxypolis fendleri, commonly known as desert copperleaf, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish to reddish blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Oxypolis fendleri is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
